html: Today, Congress is holding the first hearing on the ERA in 36 years. The absence of equal rights is a stain on our constitution and our country. We deserve to see our equality formally recognized. #ERANow
text: Today, Congress is holding the first hearing on the ERA in 36 years. The absence of equal rights is a stain on our constitution and our country. We deserve to see our equality formally recognized. #ERANow

html: The Equal Rights Amendment (#ERA) is a critical step towards equalizing men and women in the eyes of the law. We need the ERA so that our nation can achieve its full economic and social potential. #ERANow #ERAHearing
text: The Equal Rights Amendment (#ERA) is a critical step towards equalizing men and women in the eyes of the law. We need the ERA so that our nation can achieve its full economic and social potential.  #ERANow #ERAHearing

html: Black youth in America are facing a #MentalHealth crisis. They face disproportionate barriers to accessing quality, affordable mental health care, and startling new data reveals that they are dying by suicide at higher rates than their white peers.https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/to-your-health/wp/2018/05/21/suicide-rates-for-black-children-twice-that-of-white-children-new-data-show/?utm_term=.e42c889baa26 …

html: In the Massachusetts 7th, nearly 30,000 people are uninsured. A Medicare-for-all approach will meaningfully address disparities in access to health care coverage, and would help contain costs in the long-run by significantly increasing bargaining power.

html: After numerous disruptions, we made it to Central. I am so grateful to Dianna for taking the time to show me just how inequitable our transit systems are & the types of critical improvements needed to ensure accessible transit for people of all abilities.pic.twitter.com/QH5irm4yMZ
text: After numerous disruptions, we made it to Central. I am so grateful to Dianna for taking the time to show me just how inequitable our transit systems are & the types of critical improvements needed to ensure accessible transit for people of all abilities.pic.twitter.com/QH5irm4yMZ

html: When we finally got to Central Square, the only available elevator was broken, so we had to take the train to Harvard & then board a bus back to Central. This detour added 40 minutes onto our total trip time.pic.twitter.com/kuHbU79LPT
text: When we finally got to Central Square, the only available elevator was broken, so we had to take the train to Harvard & then board a bus back to Central. This detour added 40 minutes onto our total trip time.pic.twitter.com/kuHbU79LPT

html: At Park Street, where we switched from Green to Red, Dianna showed me that the elevator buttons are often too high for her / too hard to push.
text: At Park Street, where we switched from Green to Red, Dianna showed me that the elevator buttons are often too high for her / too hard to push.

html: At Lechmere Station in #Cambridge, the train went past the accessibility ramp, forcing us to wait for the next train to arrive, adding 10 mins to our trip.
text: At Lechmere Station in #Cambridge, the train went past the accessibility ramp, forcing us to wait for the next train to arrive, adding 10 mins to our trip.

html: #FBF Last Friday, my friend Dianna took me on her public transit commute so I could experience firsthand the variety of obstacles & inequities that our neighbors w/ disabilities have to face on a daily basis.pic.twitter.com/YvlHqjPSVE

text:
Shock doesn’t begin to cover it.

Today I left a hearing on homelessness & saw tons of people camped outside committee.

I turned to my staff and asked if it was a demonstration.

html: He has lied about who’s paying for it. You are. He has lied about who’s arriving at our border. Asylum seekers & terrified families. He has lied about who supports it. No former presidents. He has lied about why we need it. We don’t. Tonight will be no different.
text:
He has lied about who’s paying for it. You are. 
 
He has lied about who’s arriving at our border. Asylum seekers & terrified families.
 
He has lied about who supports it. No former presidents.
 
He has lied about why we need it. We don’t.
 
Tonight will be no different.
